newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's two exporter groups should now meet May 8.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's two exporter groups should now meet May 8.

text.p: Brazil's Coffee Exporters Federation (Febec) will ask Brazil's Coffee Exporters Association (Abecafe) to hold talks on forming a new, united association on May 8, said Febec president Oswaldo Aranha.
Earlier today a Febec spokesman mistakenly said that a six-man comission, made up of three members each from the two groups, would meet in Santos on May 5.

Instead the commission was expected to meet on May 7 but the date was aranged before exporter officials knew of a change in the date in the next meeting of Brazil's new coffee council, the CDPC, Aranha said.
The CDPC, which was to meet on May 5, will now take place on May 7 in Belo Horizonte, Minas Gerais state.
Because of the council session, Febec would now suggest the commission hold talks on May 8 in Santos, Aranha said.

Febec is Brazil's traditional exporting group and as such holds a seat on the CDPC. But in November 1995, a group of exporters broke away from Febec to form an alternative association which embraced more free market policies.
